channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Man denies 16-year-old girl's takeaway murder
item.description: Wenjing Lin died at her family's Chinese takeaway in March.

item.title: Covid: Bereaved families call for Wales-only inquiry
item.description: A woman who lost her father to Covid says she doesn't want Wales to be a "footnote" in a UK inquiry.

item.title: Wrexham: B5605 'may stay closed for years' after landslip
item.description: A road swept away by Storm Christoph last January may not reopen for years due to lack of funds.

item.title: Bute Park murder: Detectives search for potential witnesses
item.description: Dr Gary Jenkins died 16 days after he was attacked in the Cardiff city centre park in July.

item.title: Covid: Hotel thought prom-goers had negative tests before spike
item.description: More than 50 positive cases are linked to a Year 11 graduation party at a hotel.

item.title: Denbigh: Police investigate death of badger nailed to a tree
item.description: Police describe the incident as "abhorrent" and are trying to establish how the animal died.

item.title: Llandrindod Lake: Wild swimming alert as blue-green algae found
item.description: Swimmers and stand-up paddle boarders are being urged to stay away from two lakes amid concerns.

item.title: Water pollution from metal mines will cost Wales £282m, NRW says
item.description: Natural Resources Wales identifies 129 disused sites causing problems to nearby rivers and streams.

item.title: Bridgend mother in court charged with murder of her two-year-old son
item.description: Natalie Steele has been charged with the murder of two-year-old Reid Steele.

item.title: Record number of bids for UK City of Culture 2025
item.description: For the first time groups of towns or areas have been able to bid for the cultural capital title.

item.title: Weather: Warning for rain, hail and thunderstorms
item.description: The Met Office says there is a good chance Wales will see travel disruption and flooding.

item.title: Wrexham: Giant Hollywood-style sign was van-hire firm PR stunt
item.description: Mystery had surrounded who erected the giant letters at Bersham Bank colliery.

item.title: Covid: 'I watched my father, 85, die gasping for breath'
item.description: A woman, whose dad died with Covid after going to hospital with an infection, calls for answers.

item.title: Wrexham: Hollywood-style sign mystery solved
item.description: Many thought Wrexham AFC's new owners, Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney, were behind the stunt.

item.title: Wrexham: Call for funding to repair landslip-hit road
item.description: A road swept away by Storm Christoph six months ago may remain closed for years, an MS warns.

item.title: Covid: Green Man welcomes back festival fans
item.description: Buzzard Buzzard Buzzard’s Tom Rees said it was a “landmark” marking music's return to south Wales.

item.title: 'All your sacrifices have just been in vain, sweetheart'
item.description: Families affected by the Afghan war reveal their sadness and anger at the Taliban's swift resurgence.

item.title: Porthcawl: Off-duty police officer found missing man in ditch
item.description: PC Amy Rowlands found the dementia patient 30 hours after he was reported missing from his care home.

item.title: Glamorgan Cricket: Mark Wallace aims for continued success for Welsh county
item.description: Glamorgan director of cricket Mark Wallace hopes the One-Day Cup triumph acts as a springboard for future success.

item.title: Mick McCarthy: Cardiff City manager will not force vaccine on players
item.description: Manager Mick McCarthy says he can't and won't force Cardiff City's players to have the Covid-19 vaccination, despite the club suffering a number of cases over the summer.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney: Hollywood owners recognised Wrexham's 'huge potential'
item.description: Hollywood stars Rob McElhenney and Ryan Reynolds recognised the "huge potential" of Wrexham says manager Phil Parkinson.

item.title: One-Day Cup: Glamorgan captain Kiran Carlson delight at creating history
item.description: Glamorgan captain Kiran Carlson admitted he was chuffed to have created history after leading his side to their first limited overs cup final victory.

item.title: Dylan Levitt: Manchester United send Wales midfielder to Dundee United
item.description: Dundee United sign Wales midfielder Dylan Levitt on a season-long loan from Manchester United.

item.title: Covid: 'Ni'n haeddu ymchwiliad cyhoeddus penodol i Gymru'
item.description: Dynes yn ymgyrchu am ymchwiliad cyhoeddus i Gymru ar ôl i'w thad farw yn sgil rheolaeth "wael" o'r feirws.

item.title: Dyn yn gwadu llofruddio merch 16 oed yn Ynyswen
item.description: Mae Chun Xu wedi'i gyhuddo o lofruddio Wenjing Lin yn nhŷ bwyta ei theulu yn Rhondda Cynon Taf.

item.title: 'Mae pethau wedi gwella, fi'n teimlo'n gwd'
item.description: Mae David Griffiths yn un sydd wedi elwa o gefnogaeth a mentora i gael swydd a gwella ei fywyd.

item.title: Yr hunlle' eithaf... haf llawn chwaraeon!
item.description: Tydi Beth Angell heb fwynhau yr holl gampau fu ymlaen yn ddiweddar.

item.title: Morgannwg yn curo Durham i ennill y Cwpan Undydd
item.description: Morgannwg wedi llwyddo i ennill eu tlws cyntaf ers 2004 gyda buddugoliaeth o 58 o rediadau yn Trent Bridge.
